definitions.definition: To hinder, impede, or prevent.
To bring a legal proceeding against a public official.
definitions.example: President Clinton was impeached by the House in November 1999, but since the Senate acquitted him, he was not removed from office.

definitions.definition: To charge with impropriety; to discredit; to call into question.
To demonstrate in court that a testimony under oath contradicts another testimony from the same person, usually one taken during deposition.
In an affirming manner.
To heat something in preparation for further action, especially cooking
A motorcycle.
A small and light motorcycle.
To ride a motorbike; to travel by motorbike.
definitions.example: We motorbiked all over the US that summer.

definitions.definition: A free-reed keyboard wind instrument.
A sermon, especially concerning a practical matter.
A moralizing lecture.
A platitude.
Antiphon.
A choral or vocal composition, often with a religious or political lyric.
definitions.example: The school's anthem sang of its many outstanding qualities, and it was hard to keep a straight face while singing.

definitions.definition: A hymn of praise or loyalty.
definitions.example: The choir sang a selection of Christmas anthems at the service just before the big day.

definitions.definition: A very popular song or track.
To celebrate with anthems.
The edge between the pavement and the roadway, consisting of a line of kerbstones.
A stone ring built to enclose and sometimes revet the cairn or barrow built over a chamber tomb.
To damage vehicle wheels or tyres by running into or over a pavement kerb.
Rigid adherence to a particular sect, denomination, ideology, or party.
definitions.example: They were discussing sectarianism between Shias and Sunnis.

definitions.definition: A political system in which power is shared among religious sects based on a constitutional formula distributing public offices among these sects
definitions.example: In Lebanese sectarianism, one half of the members of parliament are Christians and the other half are Muslims.

definitions.definition: One who works in or with lead.
One who furnishes, fits, and repairs pipes and other apparatus for the conveyance of water, gas, or drainage.
A person who investigates or prevents leaks of information
In the Royal Navy, an apprentice, a boy aged 16 to 18, who is trained in technical skills at the Dockyard Schools to become an artificer.
A urologist.
Anything worn on the head, such as a helmet.
The harness that fits on a horse's head.
The lifting gear at the head of a mine or deep well.
The rigging on the foresail
A type of orthodontic appliance attached to dental braces that aids in correcting severe bite problems.
Struck by something.
Disabled or incapacitated by something.
(sometimes with out or through) To delete or cross out; to scratch or eliminate.
definitions.example: Please strike the last sentence.

definitions.definition: (physical) To have a sharp or sudden effect.
To thrust in; to cause to enter or penetrate.
definitions.example: A tree strikes its roots deep.

definitions.definition: (personal, social) To have a sharp or severe effect.
To touch; to act by appulse.
To take down, especially in the following contexts.
To set off on a walk or trip.
definitions.example: They struck off along the river.

definitions.definition: To pass with a quick or strong effect; to dart; to penetrate.
To break forth; to commence suddenly; with into.
definitions.example: to strike into reputation;  to strike into a run

definitions.definition: To become attached to something; said of the spat of oysters.
To make and ratify.
definitions.example: to strike a bargain

definitions.definition: To level (a measure of grain, salt, etc.) with a straight instrument, scraping off what is above the level of the top.
To cut off (a mortar joint, etc.) even with the face of the wall, or inward at a slight angle.
To hit upon, or light upon, suddenly.
definitions.example: My eye struck a strange word in the text.  They soon struck the trail.

definitions.definition: (sugar-making) To lade thickened sugar cane juice from a teache into a cooler.
To stroke or pass lightly; to wave.
To advance; to cause to go forward; used only in the past participle.
To balance (a ledger or account).
Something that must be gained in order to gain something else
definitions.example: A degree is a prerequisite for entry into this profession.

definitions.definition: In education, a course or topic that must be completed before another course or topic can be started. May be colloquially referred to as a prereq.
definitions.example: Algebra is typically a prerequisite for physics.

definitions.definition: Required as a prior condition of something else; necessary or indispensable.
definitions.example: The prerequisite warm-up to the match was ignored.

definitions.definition: In golf, the implement used to hit the golf ball.
A club or organization where golf is played.
A small bag for carrying money.
A handbag (small bag usually used by women for carrying various small personal items)
A quantity of money given for a particular purpose.
A specific sum of money in certain countries: formerly 500 piastres in Turkey or 50 tomans in Persia.
To press (one's lips) in and together so that they protrude.
To draw up or contract into folds or wrinkles; to pucker; to knit.
To put into a purse.
To steal purses; to rob.
Station wagon
One who crams or stuffs.
A book used for accelerated study in preparation for an examination.
A student who studies hard for an examination.
A teacher who aids such a student.
A school whose speciality is helping students to pass certain examinations.
(British slang) A liar.
(British slang) A lie.
Unduly confident; arrogant
definitions.example: She wins one modeling contest in Montana and suddenly she’s overweening.

definitions.definition: Exaggerated, excessive.
An excessively high opinion of oneself or one’s abilities; presumption, arrogance.
To think too highly or arrogantly of (oneself).
To make or render arrogant and overweening.
To overwhelm.
A noxious mixture of particulates and gases that is the result of urban air pollution.
To get a smog check; to check a vehicle or have it checked for emissions.
definitions.example: If the car is more than five years old, you'll have to have it smogged before you can register it.

definitions.definition: To cut into smaller pieces, parts, or sections.
definitions.example: With a little practice, you can cut up a whole chicken yourself for frying.

definitions.definition: To lacerate; to wound by multiple lacerations; to injure or damage by cutting, or as if by cutting.
definitions.example: The attackers cut him up pretty bad.

definitions.definition: To distress mentally or emotionally.
To severely criticize or censure; to subject to hostile criticism.
definitions.example: The reviewer cut up the book mercilessly.

definitions.definition: To behave like a clown or jokester (a cut-up); to misbehave; to act in a playful, comical, boisterous, or unruly manner to elicit laughter, attention, etc.
definitions.example: We need to talk about Johnny's tendency to cut up in class.

definitions.definition: To move aggressively in front of another vehicle while driving.
To disintegrate; to break into pieces.
To divide into portions well or badly; to have the property left at one's death turn out well or poorly when divided among heirs, legatees, etc.
(racing) Comprise a particular selection of runners.
definitions.example: The race has cut up badly with no real opposition to "Serendipity".

definitions.definition: Having been cut into smaller pieces.
definitions.example: Put the cut up vegetables in the pot.

definitions.definition: Wounded with multiple lacerations.
definitions.example: He is cut up pretty bad.

definitions.definition: Emotionally upset; mentally distressed.
definitions.example: She was seriously cut up over her dog disappearing.

definitions.definition: Muscular and lean.
definitions.example: I go to the gym to get stronger and cut up.

definitions.definition: The field of art concerned, roughly, with the transfer of ink or paint from a plate or block or through a screen mesh to paper.
One who is absent without permission, especially from school.
To play truant.
definitions.example: the number of schoolchildren known to have truanted

definitions.definition: To idle away; to waste.
To idle away time.
Absent without permission, especially from school.
definitions.example: He didn't graduate because he was chronically truant and didn't have enough attendances to meet the requirement.

definitions.definition: Wandering from business or duty; straying; loitering; idle, and shirking duty.
To turn away.
Having a repugnance or opposition of mind.
Turned away or backward.
Lying on the opposite side (to or from).
Turned so as to show the back, as of a right hand.
A delay or wait.
definitions.example: What is the hold-up?

definitions.definition: A robbery at gunpoint.
definitions.example: This is a hold-up! Give us all your money.

definitions.definition: The holding back of a card that could win a trick in order to use it later.
(in the plural) Women's stockings designed to be worn without suspenders.
A type of light sweet pastry or bun of French origin.
A knitted cushion for the feet.
A shallow pit or other edged depression in a road's surface, especially when caused by erosion by weather or traffic.
A pit formed in the bed of a turbulent stream.
A vertical cave system, often found in limestone.
A pit resulting from unauthorized excavation by treasure hunters or vandals.
A hole or recess on the top of a stove into which a pot may be placed.
Any of several hereditary illnesses that impair the body's ability to control bleeding, usually passed from mother to son.
A North American wild cat, Lynx rufus, having tufted ears and a short tail.
A multi-purpose construction vehicle, akin to a smaller version of a front-end loader or a backhoe (backhoe loader), with a one-man caged control cabin
A member of a religious body (often, but not always, of the clergy) officially assigned to give pastoral care at an institution, group, private chapel, etc.
A person without religious affiliation who carries out similar duties in a secular context.
A type of puppet designed to be worn on the hand like a glove.
Miniature, tiny, small.
A miniskirt.
A minicomputer.
Language outside of conventional usage and in the informal register.
Language that is unique to a particular profession or subject; jargon.
The specialized language of a social group, sometimes used to make what is said unintelligible to those not members of the group; cant.
A particular variety of slang; the slang used by a particular group.
An item of slang; a slang word or expression.
To vocally abuse, or shout at.
To throw with a circular or arcing motion.
To throw with a sling.
To pass a rope around (a cask, gun, etc.) preparatory to attaching a hoisting or lowering tackle.
To sell, peddle, or distribute illicitly (e.g. drugs, sex, etc.).
Any long, narrow piece of land; a promontory.
A fetter worn on the leg by a convict.
A counterfeit weight or measure.
A travelling show, or one of its performances.
A hawker's license.
A watchchain.
To sell (especially illegal drugs).
A particular edible plant, Spinacia oleracea, or its leaves.
Any of numerous plants, or their leaves, which are used for greens in the same way Spinacia oleraceae is.
Plants with spinach-like leaves that are noxious in some way
Plants with spinach-like leaves that have medicinal use
Somebody who gives a gift, often money to a charity.
Someone who performs good or noble deeds.
A car with a sloping, hinged rear door that opens upwards.
The door itself.
Pertaining to the Paralympics and their participants, staff etc.
Anything that encircles the neck.
A piece of meat from the neck of an animal.
definitions.example: a collar of brawn

definitions.definition: Any encircling device or structure.
definitions.example: A nylon collar kept the bolt from damaging the surface underneath.

definitions.definition: (in compounds) Of or pertaining to a certain category of professions as symbolized by typical clothing.
The neck or line of junction between the root of a plant and its stem.
A ringlike part of a mollusk in connection with the esophagus.
An eye formed in the bight or bend of a shroud or stay to go over the masthead; also, a rope to which certain parts of rigging, as dead-eyes, are secured.
An arrest.

A trading strategy using options such that there is both an upper limit on profit and a lower limit on loss, constructed through taking equal but opposite positions in a put and a call with different strike prices.
To grab or seize by the collar or neck.
To place a collar on, to fit with one.
definitions.example: Collar and leash aggressive dogs.

definitions.definition: To seize, capture or detain.
To preempt, control stringently and exclusively.
(law enforcement) To arrest.
To bind in conversation.
definitions.example: I managed to collar Fred in the office for an hour.

definitions.definition: To roll up (beef or other meat) and bind it with string preparatory to cooking.
(BDSM) To bind (a submissive) to a dominant under specific conditions or obligations.
A soldier employed in an infantry role
A brief recreational trip; a journey out of the usual way.
definitions.example: While driving home I took an excursion and saw some deer.

definitions.definition: A wandering from the main subject: a digression.
A deviation in pitch, for example in the syllables of enthusiastic speech.
To go on a recreational trip or excursion.
The middle of a stream or river.
Any American marsupial of the family Didelphidae. The common species of the United States is Didelphis virginiana.
A large ungulate, widely used as a domestic animal in Asia, South America. North Africa and Europe: Bubalus bubalis.
A water tank mounted on a trailer to be towed by a motor vehicle.
Any of the defensive players who are in position on each side farthest laterally from the ball and whose principal responsibility is to defend against passes.
definitions.example: The cornerback tipped the ball away from the receiver.

definitions.definition: To lose liquid.
definitions.example: The clogged sink drained slowly.

definitions.definition: To flow gradually.
definitions.example: The water of low ground drains off.

definitions.definition: To cause liquid to flow out of.
definitions.example: Please drain the sink. It's full of dirty water.

definitions.definition: To convert a perennially wet place into a dry one.
definitions.example: They had to drain the swampy land before the parking lot could be built.

definitions.definition: To deplete of energy or resources.
definitions.example: The stress of this job is really draining me.

definitions.definition: To draw off by degrees; to cause to flow gradually out or off; hence, to exhaust.
To filter.
To fall off the bottom of the playfield.
Lacking motivation and energy; very tired; knackered.
definitions.example: I felt so drained after that three-hour exam that I wanted to sleep for the next week.

definitions.definition: Of a battery, empty of charge; discharged.
A type of felt hat with a wide brim, typically worn by cowboys.
definitions.example: He thought his stetson made him look like a cowboy. At least it covered his bald spot.

definitions.definition: An open passage through a wood; a grassy open or cleared space in a forest.
An everglade.
An open space in the ice on a river or lake.
A bright surface of ice or snow.
definitions.example: a glade of ice

definitions.definition: A gleam of light.
A bright patch of sky; the bright space between clouds.
The name of the Latin-script letter M.
definitions.example: The ems and ens at the beginnings and ends.

definitions.definition: A unit of measurement equal to the height of the type in use.
The state of having gas, often smelly, trapped (and when released, frequently with noise) in the digestive system of a human and some other animals; wind; and when released, a flatus, a fart.
The release of such gas; breaking wind.
A sporting competition where horses are ridden around a course consisting of several jumps, to demonstrate the skill of both the rider and the horse.
A flat white (type of coffee).
A flat marinated cut of meat.
definitions.example: a chicken flattie

definitions.definition: A flat store.
A flat-bottomed sloop-rigged sharpie.
A flattie spider.
A traditional two-dimensional motion picture, as opposed to a deepie.
A flatfish.
A flathead (fish).
A flat tire/tyre.
A policeman.
A flathead V8 engine.
A hot rod fitted with a flathead V8 engine.
An automated teller machine.
Naturally aggressive or hostile; combative; belligerent; bellicose.
Assessment or sorting according to quality.
The process of sorting patients so as to determine the order in which they will be treated (for example, by assigning precedence according to the urgency of illness or injury).
(by extension) The process of prioritizing bugs to be fixed.
That which is picked out, especially broken coffee beans.
To assess or sort according to quality or some other aspect.
A pause or interruption in a poem, music, building, or other work of art.
(Classical prosody) Using two words to divide a metrical foot.
The caesura mark ‖ or ||.
A break of an era or other measure of history and time; where one era ends and another begins.
To mechanically cool a space or an entire structure.
definitions.example: In hot, muggy climates, some people air-condition their garage.

definitions.definition: Equipped with and climate-controlled by air-conditioning; cooled by an air-conditioner.
definitions.example: Our servers are kept in an air-conditioned room.

definitions.definition: A vacuum tube that displays still or moving images (such as for a television), by controlling the direction of a cathode ray emitted towards the front of the tube. The front is coated by a layer of fluorescent material, so that it emits light when struck by the beam.
A Latin American woman. (Compare Latino.)
A program or event that is broadcast across more than one medium or service at the same time.
To broadcast a program or event across more than one medium or service at the same time.
Spring.
A new period or time of youthfulness; the beginning of something.
The block of programming on television during the middle of the evening, usually between 19:00 and 23:00
Maturity; the state at which a person or product will be accepted by the mainstream.
Showing during prime time.
A movie with sound, as opposed to a silent film.
Of a diet, involving eating a lower number of calories than would normally eaten, usually with the intention of losing weight.
Of a food or drink, having fewer calories than its standard form.
According to repute or general belief.
definitions.example: The old mansion was reputedly haunted, but few were willing to go and investigate.

definitions.definition: To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.
definitions.example: He drank the water I gave him.

definitions.definition: (metonymic) To consume the liquid contained within (a bottle, glass, etc.).
definitions.example: Jack drank the whole bottle by himself.

definitions.definition: To consume alcoholic beverages.
definitions.example: Everyone who is drinking is drinking, but not everyone who is drinking is drinking.

definitions.definition: To take in (a liquid), in any manner; to suck up; to absorb; to imbibe.
To take in; to receive within one, through the senses; to inhale; to hear; to see.
To smoke, as tobacco.
An act or session by which drink is consumed, especially alcoholic beverages.
An entry posted to a blog.
A yearlong break from study taken by some students on leaving school before starting university, often spent gaining work experience or travelling
Commodities offered for sale.
definitions.example: good business depends on having good merchandise

definitions.definition: A commodity offered for sale; an article of commerce; a kind of merchandise.
The act or business of trading; trade; traffic.
To engage in trade; to carry on commerce.
To engage in in-store promotion of the sale of goods, as by display and arrangement of goods.
definitions.example: He started his career merchandising in a small clothing store chain.

definitions.definition: To engage in the trade of.
To engage in in-store promotion of the sale of.
definitions.example: He got hired to merchandise some new sporting goods lines.

definitions.definition: To promote as if for sale.
definitions.example: The record companies don't get as good a return on merchandising artists under contract.

definitions.definition: An edict or law.
The judicial decision in a litigated cause rendered by a court of equity.
The determination of a cause in a court of admiralty or court of probate.
A predetermination made by God; an act of providence.
To command by a decree.
definitions.example: A court decrees a restoration of property.

definitions.definition: A ruddy duck.
A ruddy ground dove.
To make reddish in colour.
definitions.example: The sunset ruddied our faces.

definitions.definition: Reddish in color, especially of the face, fire, or sky.
A mild intensifier, expressing irritation.
A mild intensifier, expressing irritation.
Exhibiting unsoundness or disorder of mind; not sane; mad
Used by, or appropriated to, insane persons
definitions.example: an insane asylum

definitions.definition: Causing insanity or madness.
Characterized by insanity or the utmost folly; ridiculous; impractical
definitions.example: an insane amount of money

definitions.definition: To depart from a ship.
definitions.example: As soon as the battleship docked in Singapore, Roger jumped ship, never to return.

definitions.definition: To leave something, especially suddenly or rapidly.
definitions.example: I couldn't hack it as a teacher, so I jumped ship and flew back to Australia.

definitions.definition: A location at which public transport does not ordinarily stop, but will do so if specifically requested by a passenger.
A large spoon, used for eating food from a bowl.
A spoon too large for eating, usually used for cooking or serving.
A unit of volume, the value of which varies regionally; in the US: three teaspoons or roughly 15 ml; in Britain and Canada: exactly 15 ml; in Australia: four teaspoons or 20 ml.
A bright red lamp (normally one of a pair) at the rear of a motor car that can be switched on during foggy weather so as to avoid collisions from cars approaching from behind
A bag (or other container) used to take home uneaten food from a restaurant meal.
A bag used to pick up the droppings of dogs in parks and public places.
A tree (Prunus persica), native to China and now widely cultivated throughout temperate regions, having pink flowers and edible fruit.
The soft juicy stone fruit of the peach tree, having yellow flesh, downy, red-tinted yellow skin, and a deeply sculptured pit or stone containing a single seed.
A light moderate to strong yellowish pink to light orange color.
A particularly admirable or pleasing person or thing.
Of or pertaining to the color peach.
Particularly pleasing or agreeable.
To inform on someone; turn informer.
To inform against.
A particular rock found in tin mines, sometimes associated with chlorite.
A rescue, especially a financial rescue.
definitions.example: The government bailout of that corporation is going to cost the taxpayers a hundred billion dollars.

definitions.definition: The process of exiting an aircraft while in flight.
(underwater diving) A backup supply of air in scuba diving.
A manufactured vinyl doll that has been transformed to resemble a human baby with as much realism as possible.
Revived or regenerated, especially emotionally or spiritually.
Reincarnated.
Advocate of federalism.
Supporter of the view that the province of Québec should remain within the Canadian federal system; an opponent of Québec‐based separatism or sovereigns.
A covenantalist.
Of or relating to federalism, or its advocates.
A complex network of nerves and ganglia, located within the abdomen behind the stomach.
One who harries.
Any of several birds of prey in the genus Circus of the subfamily Circinae which fly low over meadows and marshes and hunt small mammals or birds.
A runner, specifically, a cross country runner.
A kind of dog used to hunt hares; a harehound.
A low intermittent sob.
To cry or sob softly and intermittently.
definitions.example: The lonely puppy began to whimper as soon as we left the room.

definitions.definition: To cry with a low, whining, broken voice; to whine; to complain.
To say something in a whimpering manner.
definitions.example: "Master, please don't punish me!" he whimpered.

definitions.definition: An Italian dessert of fruit purée etc. on crushed ice.
Any law that sets a time limit, after which a person may not be tried for a crime, or after which some other legal action may not take place.
A speech or section used as an introduction, especially to a play or novel.
One who delivers a prologue.
A component of a computer program that prepares the computer to execute a routine.
An individual time trial before a stage race, used to determine which rider wears the leader's jersey on the first stage.
To introduce with a formal preface, or prologue.
A round neckline with a ribbed texture.
(by extension) A shirt, sweater, or similar garment with such a neckline.
Referring to the collar of pullover garments and usually of sweaters and T-shirts, when [the collar] circles the neck. Often crew necked.
Referring to a collar, whose front is meant to ride up onto the neck, sometimes to Adam's apple level, more often termed as high crew.
